participant_1.name: Alex
participant_1.personality: Anxious but determined, Alex struggles with the expectations placed on her by her parents but seeks to find her own way.
participant_1.background: I do not drink or do drugs or anything. They are constantly on my back. I just want to have fun with my friends. I work took i have a part time job at burger king.

participant_2.name: Jordan
participant_2.personality: Supportive and laid-back, Jordan enjoys helping others and believes in living life to the fullest without worrying too much about others' opinions.
participant_2.background: I love new kids on the block. I was born in the early 80 s. I take dance lessons once a week. My favorite toy as a child as my lite brite.

content.text: I'm really stressed out. My parents are constantly on my back about my grades.
Oh, that's rough. What do they want you to do?
They want me to study more and stop going out with my friends.
But you're not doing anything wrong!
I know, but they don't care.
Well, you just have to keep doing what you're doing. It's your life, not theirs.
But I don't want to disappoint them.
You're not disappointing them. You're just living your life.
I don't know. I'm just so stressed out.
Well, why don't you take a break? Go for a walk or something.
I don't know if that will help.
Good. And remember, you're not disappointing your parents. You're just living your life.
Thanks. I needed to hear that.
